Description: Fragment of a double-edged wooden comb, rectangular in shape, one end is preserved. On one edge are 17 teeth; on the other are 21 narrow closely-set teeth with 7 missing. Decoration comprises two pairs of incised parallel lines at the bases of the teeth on both sides of the comb.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), B25 Room 96 NW Section Level: below Floor 3 Crypt Fill
Exhibition history: 2013 July - October, Cambridge, The Fitzwilliam Museum, Origins of the Afro Comb
